questions.question: What do we use when we talk about plans and intentions?

choices.answer: will
going to
present simple
Present continuous

questions.question: What do we use to talk about offers and promises?

choices.answer: will
going to
present simple
Present continuous

questions.question: What do we use to talk about something that is scheduled or arranged?

choices.answer: will
going to
present simple
Present continuous

questions.question: What do we use to talk about something that we see is likely to happen?

choices.answer: will
going to
present simple
Present continuous

questions.question: What do we use to talk about predictions?

choices.answer: will
going to
present simple
Present continuous
I've seen their last game, I think Brazil will win.
I've seen their last game, I think Brazil is going to win.
I've seen their last game, I think Brazil wins.
I've seen their last game, I think Brazil is winning.
It is my birthday tomorrow.
It will be my birthday tomorrow.
It is going to be my birthday tomorrow.
It is being my birthday tomorrow.
I’m going to drive to work today.
I will drive to work today.
I drive to work today.
I am driving to work today.
Look at those black clouds. I think it’s going to rain.
Look at those black clouds. I think it will rain.
Look at those black clouds. I think it rains.
Look at those black clouds. I think it is raining.
The train arrives at 6.30 in the morning.
The train will arrive at 6.30 in the morning.
The train is going to arrive at 6.30 in the morning.
The train is arriving at 6.30 in the morning.
I’m sure you will enjoy the film.
I'm sure you are going to enjoy the film.
I'm sure you enjoy the film.
I'm sure you are enjoying the film.
Mary promised that she will help with the cooking.
Mary promised that she is going to help with the cooking.
Mary promised that she helps with the cooking.
Mary promised that she is helping with with the cooking.
I will pick up the groceries, if you like me to.
I am going to pick up the groceries, if you like me to.
I pick up the groceries, if you like me to.
I'm picking up the groceries, if you like me to.
They are going to move to Manchester.
They will move to Manchester.
They move to Manchester.
They are moving to Manchester.
Be careful! You are going to fall.
Be careful! You will fall.
Be careful! You fall.
Be careful! You are falling.

questions.question: What do we use to talk about arrangements with someone?

choices.answer: Will
Going to
Present simple
Present continuous
Sarah is getting married in May.
Sarah will get married in May.
Sarah is going to get married in May.
Sarah gets married in May.
What time are we seeing your brother tonight?
What time will we see your brother tonight?
What time are we going to see your brother tonight?
What time do we see your brother tonight?
